topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1 and 1.1.1: Post-Installation for KVM Hypervisor

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1: Post-Installation for KVM Hypervisor

p.b: This document describes the installation process for HP Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1 and HP Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1.1.

body.p: (If you already have 1.1 installed, you can update Helion OpenStack(R) from 1.1 to 1.1.1 by following the update procedures described in HP Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1.1 Update Guide.)
After you have completed and verified the HP Helion OpenStack(R) installation, perform the following tasks as appropriate.

section.title: Configure HP Helion OpenStack(R) tenant networks to use VLAN Provider Network.
section.p: HP Helion OpenStack(R) defaults to VxLAN to support tenant network isolation in a KVM Cloud Type. You can configure VLAN on HP Helion OpenStack(R) to enable communication with tenant's virtual machines hosted in a legacy infrastructure and/or based on VMWare ESX.
For instructions, see Enabling VLAN Provider Network in HP Helion OpenStack(R).

section.title: Configure Block Storage by either deploying VSA or using HP 3Par Array
section.p: Use one of the following methods to add block storage to your HP Helion OpenStack(R) cloud:

li.p: HP StoreVirtual VSA Software is a Virtual Storage Appliance that provides the complete array functionality on top of Linux KVM environment without an external array hardware. It eliminates the need for external shared storage required to implement block storage features. It uses scale-out, distributed clustering to provide a pool of storage with enterprise storage features and simple management.
For instructions, see the Configuring HP StoreVirtual VSA for Block Storage document.
An optional HP 3Par storage array that can be used to provide high performance Cinder block storage
For instructions, see the HP Helion OpenStack(R) HP StoreServ (3PAR) Support document.

section.title: Configure a Swift Scale-Out cluster (Optional)
section.p: An optional Swift Scale-Out cluster instance of between two and twelve servers that is used for production cloud Object storage use (Scale-Out Swift extends the Starter Swift Cluster enabling greater capacity while maintaining any initial data present in Starter Swift).
For instructions, see the Scale-out Swift document.

section.title: Install DNS as a service (DNSaaS) (Optional).
section.p: If you have not installed DNSaaS, see DNSaaS Installation and Configuration.

DNSaaS is our managed DNS service, based on the OpenStack(R) Designate project, is engineered to help you create, publish, and manage your DNS zones and records securely and efficiently to either a public or private DNS server network.

section.title: Create and deploy Microsoft SVVP server Microsoft as a Compute (Nova) VM. (Optional)
section.p: You can create and deploy a Microsoft Windows Server that is Microsoft SVVP (Server Virtualization Validation Program) compliant on HP Helion OpenStack(R) as a Nova compute VM.
See How to build a Microsoft Windows Server guest image for HP Helion OpenStack(R).

section.title: Add and Remove Nodes on KVM Hypervisors
section.p: For more information, see Add (Scale-Out) and Remove (Scale-In) Nodes on KVM Hypervisors.
